materials_name: gelatin  paper (fibre product)  silver sulfide  baryta paper
object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This is a gelatin silver print and the image is a top-down perspective of a bespectacled near-bald  man viewing a piece of hanging artwork with his hands behind his back.  The man in the image is fellow photographer Mun Chor Koon. On the verso, there is a chop for the 14th SIngapore Salon 1963 by The Photographic Society of Singapore. It also has the number and title of work, as well as an address addressed to the artist.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time, with an emphasis on technique, composition and tone. The subject in this photo is fellow photographer Mun Chor Kun.
context_1: An exhibition of 318 monochrome and colour prints were selected from a total of 2925 prints submitted. Record entry of more than 700 photographers from 44 countries participated.
subject_terms_1: bird's eye views stylized portraits exhibitions (events)
context_20: Address indicated on photography studio's chop.
